etymology.description: 蚝(蠔) (háo, "oyster"), 油(油) (yóu, "oil; sauce") combine to form the term for 'oyster sauce'.
etymology.interpretation: 蚝油(蠔油) (háoyóu, "oyster sauce") refers to a sauce made from oysters and usually used in Chinese cuisine. The term directly translates to 'oyster sauce', describing its key ingredient and texture.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢蚝油(我喜歡蠔油)。
炒菜的时候加点蚝油(炒菜的時候加點蠔油)，菜的味道更鲜美(菜的味道更鮮美)。
examples.pinyin: Chǎocài de shíhòu jiā diǎn háoyóu, cài de wèidào gèng xiānměi.
examples.english: Adding a bit of oyster sauce when stir-frying makes the dish taste even better.
